SENT.plain: Six patients with severe aplastic anemia treated with horse anti-human thymocyte globulin (ATG) and androgen
Four of these patients were only given ATG (ATGAMR), 16 mg/Kg/dose x 10 doses
The remaining two cases received an infusion of maternal HLA-haploidentical marrow cells following ATG therapy
One patient had a complete response, three had a partial response, one showed minimal improvement and two were non-responders
The two patients who received the additional haploidentical marrow cells showed a hematologic recovery sooner than the ATG alone cases
The toxicity of the ATG therapy was tolerable
Long term follow up of there patients and further studies of this treatment in aplastic anemia with pediatric age group are under way
